column4: anybody try installing backtrack 3 on ubuntu with vm?  I keep getting the normal startup and then it aborts and when i try to start it again it says FATAL no bootable media
frosterr what kind of driver you using?
i have an aspire one and I think the  madwifi drivers are the best
just dont want the overhead of recompiling often...but...does it work for the -7 kernel?  -11 I dont even get eth0 up
yep, but I'm only using wep :(
do you have the restricted driver manager enabled or disabled
doesnt even see hardware.  in modules nothing listed, in restricted modules common, disabled ath_hal
Im guessing that network manager isn't showing wireless networks either right?
NADA!
i cant get network manager to even know there's a card in the machine
do you know what modules, restricted modules common files look like on stock install?  Whats blacklisted and not?
type lspci in a terminal  and see if it recognizes the wifi card
03:00.0 Ethernet controller: Atheros Communications Inc. AR242x 802.11abg Wireless PCI Express Adapter (rev 01)
turn off restricted drivers and try sudo aptitude install linux-backports-modules-intrepid in terminal
that's already done - backports via sources manager, just turned off restricted.  Reloaded ath_pci and ath_hal (but thats in my restricted modules common blacklist) so I guess I should kill it
robert@AAo:~$ sudo rmmod ath_hal
blacklist ath_pci and reboot
where/which file?
/etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common
be right back.....famous last words!
no dice. even tried putting back ath_hal is blacklist and madwifi.  nothingworked
Okay man this will make it work out of the box with ath5k add jaunty's repositorys in synapti. then get the 2.6.28.6 kernel
how to do that? check intrepid proposed?
http://martino2k6.wordpress.com/2009/03/03/how-to-install-a-jaunty-jackalope-kernel-in-intrepid-ibex/
